definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to gain a firm foothold/(fig.) to get oneself established

sentences.english: The footsteps of fortune are slippery.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的脚步是滑溜溜的。
他再也听不到脚步声了。

sentences.english: The world is so big, but you only have to slow down and look carefully to see that there is splendor everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 世界这么大，只要慢下脚步，用心去看，处处皆美景。

sentences.english: the ascendant Democrats would merely drag their feet on trade matters.
sentences.chinese: 民主党的上升只会拖拽外贸的脚步。

sentences.english: Malone could hear footfalls echoing from the flooring above.
sentences.chinese: 马龙可以听到上面的脚步声回荡下来。
他将在山脚步下停步不前。

sentences.english: She halted in the shadow of a vat, allowing me to regain my feet and breath.
sentences.chinese: 她停在一个染缸的阴影里，让我匀一匀呼吸和脚步。

sentences.english: Feet clattering, black tights, skirts just short of sin.
sentences.chinese: 嘈杂的脚步声，黑色的紧身衣，造孽的短裙。

sentences.english: It does slow you down but I was able to really see each flower.
sentences.chinese: 确实慢下脚步来，而我能够真切地观赏到每一朵花。

sentences.english: The lightest feet between heaven and earth, so that we vaguely hear the waves and the Ocean Waves.
sentences.chinese: 天地间最轻的脚步，使我们依稀听到浪潮和涛声。

sentences.english: In his heart a man plans his course, but the Lord determines his steps.
sentences.chinese: 人心筹算自己的道路，惟耶和华指引他的脚步。

sentences.english: Others have wondered if Groupon is growing too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 而其他人也怀疑团宝网的发展脚步是否太快了。

sentences.english: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
sentences.chinese: 确认你的起点无虑，然后站稳脚步。

sentences.english: We bent our steps towards home.
The crippled old man dragged along slowly.
sentences.chinese: 跛足老人拖着沉着的脚步缓慢地往前走。

definition: to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to catch up with/to keep pace with
to come to a stand/to stop
to step out/to take a (first) step
